roleset.name: get better
roleset.note: RECOVERY-N NOTES: Roleset based on recover.01. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from recovery.01-n)

role.descr: that which was sick, now getting better

example.name: basic unaccusative
example.text: Still, he added, if the industrial sector remains relatively stable, Rockwell-1 should be able *trace*-1 to recover in the second half and about equal fiscal 1989's operating profit of $630.9 million.

example.name: with sickness
example.text: The Nasdaq over-the-counter market didn't fully recover from a selling stampede, and closed down 1.2%.

example.name: Example with args 1 and 2
example.text: The city 's recovery from the earthquake

example.name: Another with arg 2 only
example.text: The recovery from Hurricane Hugo and the California Earthquakes
example.arg: from Hurricane Hugo and the Cailfornia Earthquakes

roleset.name: get back
roleset.note: RECOVER-V NOTES: Member of Vncls obtain-13.5.2. (from recover.02-v)
RECOVERY-N NOTES: Roleset based on recover.02. Verbnet class obtain-13.5.2. Famed by Katie. (from recovery.02-n)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: New York stocks recovered some of their losses after the London market closed.

example.name: odd usage of arg2
example.text: Other lenders have been recovering only 50 cents to 60 cents on the dollar on foreclosed Arizona property, if they can sell it at all.
example.arg: only 50 cents to 60 cents on the dollar
if they can sell it at all

example.name: better (?) example of arg2
example.text: Mary recovered her books from John.

example.name: I don't know if people actually say this (they do)
example.text: After one too many spills, John-1 was forced *trace*-1 to recover his sofa.
